Doesn't live up to the hype. While the vermouth and the service was among the best I've had in Barcelona,  the same can't be said for the food.  The only food my wife cared for was the potato crisps- something that was so simple, a kid could have made it.   The pork rhinds were also quite underwhelming.  Being from El Paso, chicharrones are something that I've been familiar with for a long time, due to neighboring Ciudad Juarez.  I have to say, Mexico does it better.  Maybe my experience was an anomally, but all but one place I've been in Barcelona that has a hyped up reputation has been underwhelming (The exception being Vaso De Oro).
